Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, near the airport.”
Reviews.Author: Klinf
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for one night only, since we arrived late in Las Vegas. We sleep and the next day we went to another one on the Strip. The hotel is close to the airport, but far from the Strip. The stay was very good. The room is big, clean and comfortable. And the cookies are delicious!

Reviews.Title: “Love the Doubletree!”
Reviews.Author: KeroppiQueen
Reviews.Content: This Doubletree is located near the Las Vegas airport and in a residential area, so it is far from the strip. Since we had a car, we didn't have any issues. We stayed here on January 1, 2012 for $83/night. The price was one of the cheaper places to stay for that date. I've always loved the chocolate chip cookies that they give at the front desk. So delicious! Note that the delivery of fresh cookies come after 9am. We checked out before 9am and didn't get to have cookies for the trip back home. The hotel had good amenities for the room. Loved the free wifi and no resort fee!!!! King size bed was comfy. There was also a coffee maker and Crabtree & Evelyn toiletries. Unfortunately, there wasn't a safe, microwave, or mini fridge in the room. The room didn't look old to me. Plus, we were on the top level, so we didn't have any issues with noise.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient stop for Las Vegas airport”
Reviews.Author: JK_SurreyUK
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here for one night with my Dad as we were arriving back into Vegas (from Death Valley) on a Friday evening, fairly late, and didn't want the hassle of long check-in lines at one of the Strip hotels. We also had a silly-AM departure the next morning from LAS, and this hotel just made great sense, given its location. The hotel had plentiful parking, was clean, spacious and comfy rooms and great service from the reception staff. I really couldn't fault it. There was also a great system for printing airline boarding cards in place - using your laptop you could simply send the file to print from your room, go downstairs to the business centre, tap in a code you've been given and hey presto, your items print. More hotels should have this! Hotel is highly recomended, and I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Handy hotel”
Reviews.Author: TimMelbourne_AUS
Reviews.Content: I was very happy with my stay here. The rooms are very good for a airport hotel and the airport/MGM grand free shuttle was very handy and I used it often.

Reviews.Title: “Off the Las Vegas Strip and close to the airport”
Reviews.Author: MyZenworks
Reviews.Content: This Double tree property while off the Las Vegas strip it is easy access to the airport. A good business trip hotel with an unusually setup breakfast buffet. The amenities are satisfactory with a good exercise room equipped with free-weights and cardio-machines. The happy hour is not free at this hotel. It maybe true for most Las Vegas hotels, I found the room comfortable with large 42" TV. The shower was just okay. The staff are very pleasant and helpful. As a result, it is a good business hotel. Good value

Reviews.Title: “Solid hotel, near the airport and off-strip - great value for money”
Reviews.Author: kawoh
Reviews.Content: Excellent Doubletree property with friendly attentive staff. The rooms are clean, modern, not the newest but still excellent. The gym is very well equipped with 4 jogging machines, elipitcal trainers, free weights. The breakfast included for gold/diamonds is cafeteria style - not the most amazing of doubletree breakfasts, but good enough to get you started. The complimentary shuttle was great including the drop offs at the strip. Late checkout was offered which was excellent and the rate was amazing. if you want an offstrip property without all the smoke and the gaming floors - this is an oasis in Las Vegas. After a week at Bellagio, i was SO excited to come and stay at this property believe it or not. There is also an outdoor swimming pool

Reviews.Title: “This is what i have been waiting for”
Reviews.Author: jmrws1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect. as long as you consider "perfect" being removed from the neon of Las Vegas. The rooms are large and well kept. Beds are comfortable and the TV's are large Sometimes a hotel employee can make your experience great or horrible. In this case it was great. Unfortunately i did not get the name of the cook at breakfast, but he was exceptional. Internet is not great but compares well to most hotels

Reviews.Title: “Very nice - would stay again”
Reviews.Author: UNLVMom
Reviews.Content: Booked through Hotwire. Nice hotel, very convenient to airport, beds very nice, amenities very nice, very clean. Staff ok too. I would most definitely stay here again with no problem.

Reviews.Title: “The best deal and the most lovely stay near the LAS airport”
Reviews.Author: ikar77
Reviews.Content: The DoubleTree hotel was chosen only because it was really inexpensive (only $50 per night) and it was near the airport, so of course we hadn't any expectations about our stay. What expect from the $50 per night stay, except just the place to sleep? We were wrong :) The first cute surprise was the welcome warm homemade cookies. Mmmm. The second surprise was the cold fresh lemonade in the hotel lobby. The third surprise was the chocolates on the pillows. But the main surprise I wasn't able to find any slot machine in the lobby! It was unbelievably cool to relax in quiet DoubleTree lobby after smoke-filled casinos in Las Vegas.. The room was perfect and clean. The staff was kind and helpful. BTW, the hotel offers free transportation to the airport (it's free, but the driver was very insistent about the tips). Well, definitely DoubleTree by Hilton Las Vegas Airport is the most lovely airport hotel we have ever been, especially for $50.

Reviews.Title: “Very good place to stay and hold meetings”
Reviews.Author: LMohrSugarLand
Reviews.Content: This was a business trip with a couple days added for pleasure, so I can comment from both perspectives. The hotel's front desk personnel are very helpful and courteous. The meeting personnel are the best I've seen in awhile, and i travel a couple times a month doing meetings. I especially give accolades to Spencer and Herman. They were proactive in making sure my meeting room was exactly how I wanted it both days. The food was pretty good too. The sleeping room was average, but the bed was very comfortable. There were lots of pillows, nice sheets, etc. This hotel brags about the air quality, and I have to say, as a non-smoker, it was very nice to be able to breathe at a hotel in this city. The casinos are fun, but I feel sick after a few hours of second-hand smoke. This hotel also has a shuttel service to and from the airport every half hour or so. They are good at notifying you of the times it's available, and the driver is a nice guy. The shuttle also runs to the MGM hotel once every hour and will pick up once every hour until 10 PM if you ask. On the negative side, the hotel is not on the strip. In Vegas, it is really fun to be able to walk out of your room and be "in the action". If I was traveling for pleasure alone, I probably wouldnt stay here, unless they increase there shuttle runs to make them more frequents and also take you downtown to the Freemont Street area. And I feel redundant in saying this because most hotels have this problem....the walls are a bit thin. Why would any hotel that is not full, ever put a child on the same floor as business people? Business people don't want to be around screaming babies, or loud people of any age. We come to work and need to be able to sleep without hassles. Sorry, but not that many hotels give a crum about this issue, so I'm putting it in here in hopes their manager will find an innovative way to cure the issue. If so, this hotel would be excellent. For small meetings, this is a great hotel. They also have a business center for printing whatever you want, easy to use free wi-fi, a safe looking exercise gym, desks in the lobby bar to use for working, and happy hour daily.

Reviews.Title: “Reconsider Staying Here!”
Reviews.Author: Bellaboobird
Reviews.Content: After my experience at your hotel, there is little chance I would ever book there again. I felt your front desk staff were not really supportive in resolving the issues that I had. My first experience was that I asked for early check in at 10:30am as I had flown all night from Hawaii. The manager said he only had smoking rooms available (I am alergic). So I waited in the lobby. Instead of him checking, say every 15 min to see if a room was made up, I had to ask again at 11:30am to see if a room was available. It was. He insincerely said, "sorry for the wait." After a short nap, I came down to catch the bus to the MGM. Only to find out that it only left every hour, not every half hour as I understood from the website. I left the room at 12:30pm the next day and the cleaning person asked if I wanted my room made up. I thought it was strange that she asked that question. When I returned late that night, I realized that my trash had not been removed. The next day I left about the same time or maybe 12:45pm. I took the do not disturb sign off my door before leaving. When I returned about 9:30pm, I discovered my room had not been cleaned at all. When I called the front desk, all they could do was to send up more towels as there was no cleaning staff. The next morning when I was checking out, I told the manager I was displeased and would like some compensation. She said because I pre-booked she could not do anything. Never apologized for the problems I experienced. I asked if she could remove my tab from the bar...less than $20. She said she would ask the other manager. He said he would research to see if anyone had come into my room and either call or email me. I was insulted! It seemed like they thought I was lying or something. I told the desk manager that I would have appreciated at least an apology. She THEN said she apologized. Would definintely NOT stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Oh Yeah! This DoubleTree Surprise Was Good!”
Reviews.Author: Lifetraveler1
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights at Sam's Town Gambling Hall and Hotel, while attending 2012 CES convention. However, when I wanted to add a fourth night (this Friday), the nightly rate doubled. So I hopped on priceline and this Doubletree accepted my bid of about $50 for the one night. With taxes I saved about 30% off the rate of the other hotel. Location: This Doubletree hotel is located very close to Las Vegas International Airport, in fact it is pretty much across the expressway (I-215) from the airport in what looks like a low-rise office complex. It is convenient because I have a rental car and the facility to return the car is about 5 blocks away from the hotel. Its proximity to the airport does allow you to hear aircraft taking off once in awhile. However, the noise is not loud and intrusive. There are no restaurants close by, but there is a Starbucks about one block away. To get to the Las Vegas strip there is a shuttle that will drop you off at the MGM Grand once an hour. It also will take you to the airport. The Building: The grounds are fine, but this is a desert town, so there is not a lot of foliage. However, the building itself looks relatively new and the parking lot is well lit. The lobby is bright and inviting and the staff is very courteous and they offer you a warm cookie (it's a DoubleTree thing). The Hallway: It appears to be well maintained and it is very well lit. The rooms use the key card type for access. When I first tried to access the room, my key card didn't work. The front desk personnel apologized, reconfigured the card and was going to send an engineer up to make sure that there was no problem. The new card worked fine. The Room: It is very long with a little foyer on the other side of the bathroom. You could easily accommodate a family of four in here without feeling too squeezed. That assumes that you get a roll-out type bed for the kids. The walls are a gold/tan combination with white ceilings. The carpet is some squiggly pattern with gold/beige as the dominant color. The furnishing look pretty good, only the business table looks a little scuffed up. The multi-colored earth tone curtains match the mirror and compliment the rest of the room. There is an LCD TV, four lamps, a refrigerator and a safe (yeah baby). So if you had an extended stay, you could get a few grocery items to keep your cost down. The Beds: The coverings on the bed are kind of just one plain light mocha color. However, I welcome the fact that this bed actually has a spread on it. Why? Because it gives it more weight with the blanket and sheet. I sleep better when I have more weight on me. As far as the comfort level of the mattress, I would give it a 7 out of 10. The Bathroom: Well, it is really is not that big. Just one person at a time will do. There is only one sink in the bathroom. Issues: The only one I have found is that there is a faint stain on the bedspread on the other bed. It is quiet here, but that also means you are isolated from the activities of the strip. So you will need a car, if you want true flexibility out here. Other than that I really don't have anything to fuss about. For the money I paid and the high quality room that I got, it was a nice surprise. Other Item: I've been to Vegas many times, but I wanted to see something new. So I drove on to Red Rock Canyon. The views are breathtaking and the sky is clear blue, try it! On the way back I saw a casino that looked brand new. It was Red Rock Casino. Try that too. For they had the, 'Feast Buffet'. It was priced like the buffets from years ago ($5, $8 and $14), yet the food quality was better than some of the good ones on the strip that charge ($15, $12 and $30). Try that too!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location away from the Strip.”
Reviews.Author: bjaysfan21
Reviews.Content: I had a great pre-paid rate from this hotel. The free shuttle helped to not have a car. The hotel is located away from the LV strip and is in an office park location. As a result, there are not many food choices, however, I did find a great nearby local restaurant that served both Breakfast and Lunch. In the area was a great Starbucks and 711. My room was ok. The carpet looked warn out, but the bed was incrediblely soft and I dozzed off immediately. The hotel was quiet and the check-in service was outstanding. Being so close to McCarran, I didn't hear any airplane noice. Stayed at this location many years ago and I use to have a great AuBonPain cafe. That cafe no longer exists. Didn't try the food at the bar/restaurant, so I can't tell if there has been an improvement.

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelmed”
Reviews.Author: AONE5
Reviews.Content: I had expected a better experience here, given the positive reviews on TA. Overall, not a good stay. I needed a hotel close to the airport for a quick overnight stay - I wanted to get in, check-in, eat, sleep and get out without fuss. This didn't happen. 1) It took over an hour to get a shuttle ride from the airport to the hotel at 8pm, despite frequent calls which always promised the van was five minutes away. 2) Check-in had a fifteen minute wait as only one member of staff was on duty and seemed to be doing everything. 3) Hotel itself seemed down at heel and in need of a little TLC 4) Room Service Pizza - Yuch. 5) Check-out in the early hours - no shuttle again, despite timetable. Had to be placed in a shared cab. Improve the service and it would be a 3. Improve the food and decor, it could be a 4.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our Stay”
Reviews.Author: Supernen
Reviews.Content: We needed somewhere clean and nice to stay while driving through Las Vegas. I really enjoyed my stay. The staff was very helpful and even located my daughter's bag that she had left in the room after check out. I was very impressed that they were able to recover it all and that everything was as she left it. The room felt very clean and I loved the bath supplies that were proveded by Crabtree and Evelyn. They had a nice fresh scent and were something I actually wanted to use instead of my personal things I brought. If I ever need to stay in Vegas, I would pick this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Steelers15104
Reviews.Content: Employees were more than gracious and helpful. VERY reasonable rates. Shuttle service to/from the strip was constantly used.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant off-Strip stay closento airport no airport noise”
Reviews.Author: saranger
Reviews.Content: Spent one night here with spouse. Check-in was fast and efficient. Fresh warm cookies given. Room on 4th floor. Single-serve coffee maker in room-made cup of Eoldgang Puck de-caf to enjoy w/cookie. Nice room, tastefully decorated with Crabtree and Evelyn bath amenities. Comfy bed, good linens, side chair, ottoman, desk/chair, flat screen TV. Enough light for reading in bed. Boa casino so quiet, but wall between our room and neighbor was thin and their loud conversation woke us up when they returned from partying at 5:00am. Breakfast for diamond HH members is free "buffet" is restaurant. This includes coffee, juice, yogurt, fruit, eggs, potatoes, bacon, cereal, toast/bagel, etc. Spencer in the restaurant is great. Other man in restaurant refused to take free buffet coupon provided by front desk. Said two people need two coupons, even though desk clerk wrote (2) on coupon. Spencer was empowered to resolve the problem. Small business center with two computers and printers for working and printing boarding passes. Free coffee in the lobby at breakfast-time. Spent 4 nights at 4 different properties in Las Vegas last week to retain Diamond HH status for 2012. This was the 2nd best property. The Hampton Inn was our favorite for peace and quiet, location to off-Strip restaurants, friendly staff, and great rooms.

Reviews.Title: “OK, With Room for Improvement”
Reviews.Author: TheLiterati
Reviews.Content: Recently booked a pre-paid three night stay here for the Las Vegas Rock N Roll Marathon. Found the deal to be a good value, considering I didn't want to stay on the strip. At the time, I didn't consider the logistics of getting back into town for the race - and later learned that on-strip hotels had similar offers - but I was locked in, so I went through with my plans. I'd mistakenly booked a King room, and wanted a double Queen instead, which was generously accommodated upon my arrival. I'd been expecting a few of my marathon teammates to join me in my stay, so needed the extra bed. Immediately upon walking into the room, I was greeted with a sour, mildewy odor that I couldn't put my finger on. I thought maybe the bathroom had been wiped down with a musty towel, but upon taking my first shower realized the smell was coming from the shower curtain. It was soon changed upon request and the odor went away. When readying for bed the first night, I looked down at the carpet between the two beds (in front of the shared nightstand) and saw a huge pinkish stain on the carpet. It looked like fruit juice or something, but it was disturbing just the same. To be safe, I called down to the desk to report it. I didn't want to be charged for something that was present when I checked in. My bed and accommodations were mostly comfortable, but I found the hotel to be dated a bit and greatly in need of some TLC. Things like cleaning the grout between tiles in the bath/shower, cleaning/repairing stained or frayed carpets (as others have mentioned), etc. Most of these are minor things, but they all add up. One odd thing that happened during my stay was finding a six-pack of beer (with one empty bottle) at my door one morning. Not sure I can fault the hotel for this, but for the life of me I could not figure out how it got there since I didn't know anyone else staying there, and it wasn't something I had ordered / asked for. I chalked up it to a fluke / perhaps a drunken mistake by another guest, but it was still kind of odd. All in all a decent hotel with room for improvement and need for attention to details. Staff was pleasant and easy to deal with, and while not perfect, if I could not find a similar deal on the strip, I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Needs attention”
Reviews.Author: txrus
Reviews.Content: It's been 3 yrs since my first stay, & review, of this property but I felt the condition I found it in on this trip warrant an update. Title says it all-it needs attention. Carpet in the halls & rooms dirty & fraying. Door to room took 3 attempts each time to get the door to unlock & deadbolt wouldn't work once inside. Towels in the bathroom are dingy gray. Bolt covers for the toilet seat missing completely & what's visible is pretty nasty. The vent in the bathroom is just as nasty & drains in both sink & shower nearly completely rusted over. Made the mistake of opening up the plastic cover for the spare pillow in the closet-not sure what was in there, but it was nasty, as well. Internet in the business center verrrrrry slow. I have a feeling the owners have been delaying maintenance due to the economy & drop in hotel occupancy, but that's going to come back to bite them if it goes much longer.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Traveler5_10
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great place to get away from the glitz and busy-ness of this city! It has everything you need - a shuttle from the airport, business center without added cost, gym and pool, its own restaurant and lounge and other restaurants close by. Rooms are clean and comfortable, staff is responsive, The price is also right!

Reviews.Title: “Civilized, fairly clean, friendly and attentive”
Reviews.Author: 6530bx4
Reviews.Content: Las Vegas is a gamble in many, many ways and your hotel stay is one of them. Extravagant hotels can have an indifference when it comes to your room, cleanliness and service. Casino properties may be convenient but the noise and stress can become a pain. Also, there's limited "real world" shopping along the strip. The Doubletree near the airport is one of those beacons away from the cacophony of the strip. Yes, it's an older property and clearly not perfect. The tradeoff is that it's a non-gaming property not that far from the strip if you have a car and far enough away if you want nothing to do with what happens on the strip. Checking in was painless, friendly and nonharried. The room was basically clean with a laptop safe. The warm cookies at the front desk was a welcome touch. I rated this hotel a bit higher than deserved -- there isn't a "good" between "average" and "very good" -- but it's not an issue. There is a "real world" Las Vegas most tourists never see and this hotel is near ordianary shopping and dining like we'd have back home. Unfortunately, my meal at the nearby Applebee's wasn't very good. When I was asked for feedback by the manager I mentioned this and he actually seemed genuinely concerned. As a business traveler, I found this to be true in much of Las Vegas away from the flash and trash -- warm, friendly, helpful people who really seem to like meeting and helping people who aren't there to get drunk and wild and tear up the place. Seriously. There's no denying that this hotel has some years under its belt and I was worried a bit when I won it on Priceline but the location, good service and attempt to provde a clean room and good working evironment for business travelers (and even for those tourists who'd like to have a respite from the craziness) makes up for it. There's a fairly new Hampton Inn near the airport for those who want a more modern place. I was here for a day and would have no problem coming back. Not sure about a long stay but for me Las Vegas is a base camp.

Reviews.Title: “Solid 3-star; quiet and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: KittyChan
Reviews.Content: I decided to give the Doubletree Club Hotel (DCH) LAS a try after getting a very good rate ($60/night) on Expedia. Given the DCH's mid-pack ranking on TA, I wasn't expecting a life-changing experience staying there over Veterans Day Weekend, but the hotel's proximity to the airport, rental-car center, and major roads (Strip, I-15 and 215) appealed to me. I wasn't disappointed. While the DCH's structure and decor are plain -- again, solid if unremarkable 3-star -- my standard room (5th floor, with a partial view of the Strip in the distance; quite nice) was large and very comfortable. The heating and A/C was a rather odd mix of modern digital wall-mounted thermostat and clunky old below-the-window fan unit. It was fairly chilly weather in Vegas (40s at night, low 60s during the day), but setting my room's thermostat at 68 had the wall unit clumsily cycling between heating and A/C modes. I found myself sometimes having to run the thermostat up 5 or 6 degrees to turn the A/C off and get the HVAC unit to clunk over to heating mode. The one feature I liked was that one could have the fan running continuously (auto-mode override on the wall thermo) on either low or high speed, which I appreciated for white noise. I heard very little noise, though; mainly just the normal thumps and bumps of hardworking maids in the morning (which the fan mostly filtered out). I liked the DCH's location; it's a 2- or 3-minute drive from the rental-car center and airport. With the nearest 1-15 North exit closed, the hotel's proximity to Las Vegas Blvd/Strip was a bonus. As with most of Vegas's chain 3-stars, the DCH is on a quiet street (Pollock) just off a major road (Warm Springs). Parking is plentiful and right in front on the hotel. Check-in was a breeze, as was check-out (which I did from my room's new-looking LG LCD TV). I also appreciated the DCH's provision of complimentary internet service (not very fast/limited to 750 Kbps but reliable and fine for ordinary surfing and e-mail) and very good Wolfgang Puck coffee -- with little real half-and-half creamers, as opposed to the cheap powdered nondairy creamer that too many hotels provide. And the warm chocolate-chip-and-nut cookie at check-in was very tasty. Little things, but they do make a difference. I'd stay here again; it's a good value (excellent at the rate I paid). Good job, DCH LAS.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel away from the strip”
Reviews.Author: nimen_hao
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights because of the much lower cost than staying on the strip. The hotel was nice, clean, and friendly. The only downside was the money we saved on the rooms was compensated by having to pay for cab fares. There is a free shuttle to the strip every hour (but make sure you put your name down early as we got bumped to the next one as it was full of airport riders), but the shuttle back to the hotel only goes until 10pm. The cab back was about $20, and the first night the cabbie was angry that we got in his cab and wanted him to go all the way to the hotel ("it's the prime time of night, I don't want to have to go there, I won't get a fare on the way back!). We coaxed him into it, but be aware that some cabbies might not be too happy with you. It's a nice hotel, but consider the lower cost but not end up saving you money after all.

Reviews.Title: “Great value away from the Vegas craziness”
Reviews.Author: jc44
Reviews.Content: We stayed here twice within two weeks. Both times, the room was spotless, the linens were crisp and fresh. We had the pool almost to ourselves on a beautiful sunny Saturday afternoon. We used the shuttle to go to and from the airport and to go to and from the strip via the MGM drop-off point. It was ok for us as we didn't have time concerns. However, a lot of people use the shuttle and a couple times there was not enough room for everyone to get on.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Gary39393
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 1 night as it was near the airport. It was extremely clean and the staff was friendly. I would recommend a stay at this hotel. No frills, but excellent with the basics.

Reviews.Title: “Great Business Hotel Off The Strip”
Reviews.Author: 32847Apps
Reviews.Content: Doubletree Hotels are always great business hotels but, in Vegas, for business, I find it's best to be off the Strip. The Doubletree Club Hotels LAS has great Freeway access, without the noise, staff is competent and hotel is in great shape. Don't forget the cookie!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Suprise”
Reviews.Author: cruisefanz4ever
Reviews.Content: We checked in to the hotel at 3 p.m. on a Saturday. Got our warm cookies, yum and some ice water in the lobby with fresh fruit in the pitchers, nice flavor!! Very convenient from the strip and airport. Fast and friendly check-in process. Room was nice!!! We went to the lobby bar for happy hour. Our bartender, Jeremy, was awesome. We talked about the local area and he was suggesting some local restaurants at the request from another couple seated next to us at the bar. But as the evening went on, we just ended up staying and ordering food from the hotel. We had the turkey panini and a small pizza. Both good and reasonably priced. The turkey was especially awesome!!! We slept good. Very comfortable and quiet room. We did purchase the breakfast the next morning, but the buffet could be a little better. Over all, especially considering the low price for a Saturday night in Vegas so close to the action, I highly recommend this hotel. I will definately be back next time in Vegas!!!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap chain hotel due for an update”
Reviews.Author: abd1958
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here several times. Pros are it is close to McCarran Rental Car Center and usually $50 below other full service Hilton (or Marriott) properties. But, it's cheaper for a reason. Rooms are tired. Air conditioning very loud, bathrooms have funky shower valves. Don't stay here unless you have a car.

Reviews.Title: “Far from the strip, yet great value.”
Reviews.Author: LukeOnTheRoad
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a little off the stage, close to the highway, and there's really no place around you can walk to. Nevertheless it is convenient, clean, with friendly staff, and provides an excellent free shuttle service to/from the MGM hotel and to/from the Airport. 10 minutes to the airport, 15 to 20 minutes to the strip. Breakfast is a little basic, but I'll stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Cookies”
Reviews.Author: Joan C
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a top choice for us due to it's proximity to the airport. The only glitch was when we tried to check in early - the clerk at the desk was curt and seemed harried. However, when we returned a little later, we were greeted in a friendly manner and given our cookies right away. This hotel is very modern, clean and inviting. Our room was spacious and clean. We had $2 drinks (wine/beer) in the lounge - a good value. We did not eat here - the prices for breakfast were too high for us. We would stay again if needed.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mgmj
Reviews.Content: We only stayed for one night, but I would definitely recommend this place. Room was very comfortable, clean and quiet. You begin your stay with warm chocolate chip cookies and a beverage. Parking is right out front. The best thing is the free shuttle service to the entrance of the MGM hotel. They drop you off and you call them 10 minutes before the top of the hour, and they pick up back up. Applebees is within walking distance. For just over 60 bucks a night, this is the place to stay in Vegas. ( We stayed the night of 9/25/11)

Reviews.Title: “Great secret lodging place for Vegas vacation.”
Reviews.Author: Justgivemevalue
Reviews.Content: Staying at the casino resorts is great to do if: 1) it's your first time in Vegas, 2) money is no object. But the most practical place is stay is in a business hotel like this one. $60/night on a Friday or Saturday? Are you kidding? Free parking that's only a 30sec walk away? Are you kidding? Free wifi, no party noise in the hallway early in the morning, and just 4 miles from casinos? Are you kidding?

Reviews.Title: “Non-gaming hotel in Las Vegas.”
Reviews.Author: FridaPoulsen
Reviews.Content: We were recommended to stay at this hotel as a transit route to the Grand Canyon. And it was a good choice. Room was good enough, and great beds. It was clean and neat. They shuttle from the airport, but we could not find the bus stop. And because we were tired after a long flight, we took a taxi the short distance to the hotel. Later we understood that you had to call the hotel and ask to be picked. In the evening we tried the complimentary shuttle bus down to The Strip. It worked fine. There is a sea of neon lights and slot machines, and it would be wise not to have too much money with you. So it was actually a relief to get back to our quiet hotel which has absolutely no gaming machines! Breakfast was adequate and worth the 11 dollars ( Admitting, that we are tourists from europe..). It was so fortunate that the shuttle bus drove past the car rental company where we had to pick up the car in the morning. All we can really complain about was the terrible noisy aircondtion. We had to turn it of, or else it was impossible to fall asleep. We might visit this hotel again, but only in periods of the year, when you kan be without the aircon.

Reviews.Title: “What a pleasant surprise!”
Reviews.Author: smokymtndeb
Reviews.Content: I was on my way home from a trip to the midwest and missed my connection at LAS. Unfortunately I had to overnight. Fortunately I found the right place to take care of me!! I called as soon as I landed at LAS and made sure the Doubletree had rooms available. I was able to book directly with the front desk and was told that the shuttle was on its way. It was already late (11pm and a 3 hour time difference--ended up being a very long day for me) and I was extremely tired, but the shuttle arrived in less than 5 minutes (thumbs up!!). Upon arrival at the front desk I was greeted by a very friendly young man. Within minutes I was in my room, along with some very warm cookies. My room was spacious, clean and quiet. The bed was beyond comfortable!! What more could I ask for after an extremely long day?? Unfortunately I had to get up early to catch my flight home so I wasn't able to eat breakfast there. My check out experience was just as wonderful as my check in experience. The shuttle was extremely prompt getting me back to the airport in time to catch my flight home. If you're looking for some place to stay away from the strip or because you are stranded at LAS, this is the place. Most properties don't offer shuttle service. This was a definite plus in my decision to stay here. I know that in the future if I'm ever stranded at LAS again, this will be the place that I call!!

Reviews.Title: “What a great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Rog62
Reviews.Content: Check-in as usual was very quick, easy and professional. This is the third time I’ve stayed here over the last three years and without fail everyone is helpful and polite. The rooms are big, clean and tidy. Beds are always very clean and comfortable. There is always an excellent food choice for breakfast, there’s the hot buffet food left out, or the specials you can order over the counter from chef. The only tiny complaint I had this year was the sliding doors on the fitted wardrobe (207) were jammed and came off their rails – but this is me being very picky. Overall, this is a great place to stay for your first night in Vegas if it’s later in the day and you’ve just picked up a hire car to start a tour of the Southwest The Doubletrees is near McCarron airport and a just few minutes drive from the main Las Vegas car rental centre.

Reviews.Title: “Gem in Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: Agnes921
Reviews.Content: I love this place -- I"ve stayed here half a dozen times over the last three years. It's conveniently located near McCarren airport, rooms are large, beds are comfortable, exercise facility is great. Refrigerator in room if you request it. Front desk staff have been consistently helpful and friendly. Just a sweet, quiet location away from the Strip. Rates are great --- makes renting a car economical. Will definitely stay here again and again!

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant - Strip Alternative Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mscab
Reviews.Content: I needed a hotel for a quick one night stay on my way to Zion. This hotel is a perfect, affordable, Alternative to the hustle and bustle of Strip hotels. The staff was extremely welcoming and friendly. The room was a great value for the price. Overall I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice for the price.”
Reviews.Author: jondf
Reviews.Content: Probably my 8th or 9th stay here. Positives: cheap, really cheap I paid $60 without advance payment. Staff is really nice. Rooms clean. 2 minutes from rental car center, 5 minutes from airport. Negatives: miles from the strip or major casinos. Nearby eats limited to an Applebees next door :(. I will stay hee again.

Reviews.Title: “Horrilbe experience”
Reviews.Author: Travelingon_11
Reviews.Content: It still makes me so angry that I cannot write a clear review. I had a reservation, Sunday, July 31, which I booked online. After the horrible and long night after being denied my reservation. I did verify that I did in fact have a confirmed reservation and the Double Tree had made a mistake. The hotel made no effort to correct or apologize. I have not used a HiltonHonors hotel since. The online service has contacted me several times to explain what happened, to see what else needed to be done and aplogize on behalf of the Double Tree. I chose this hotel because it has shuttle servece to airport and I was there a day before the rest of our group to have all the rental cars and conference registrations ready. When I Arrived on Sunday night the hotel did answer when I called for shuttle service. A van finally came and took me to the hotel where thre were several people in line. The hotel did not have enough rooms so they very slowly and rudely sent at least 6 others to a Hampton Hotel, one person in a van at a time. After 45 minutes of waiting in line I was told did not have a reservation so they would not help me. The Manager on Duty, Michael, was by far the rudest and most incompetent "hospitaltiy" employee I have ever experienced. I worked with an airline for 21 years and travel extensively, never has any hotel been this unprofessional or rude. I finally asked if they could at least transport me to the other hotel, where I would pay for room at double rate I had booked. Iwas the only one they did not give a voucher to. The shuttle driver took me to the wrong hotel and we ended up driving around so long I just asked the Hampton front desk if they had any suggestions on how to find what went wrong with my reservation. The front desk employee gave me a a number with very little effort. It was so late it was hardly worth checking, unpacking and packing again so I just went to the hotel where we staying the rest of the week. I waited in the lobby the remainder of the night and was given an early check in at 9:00 am Monday morning. If you have an online confirmation number, it 99% correct that it is valid. Be sure to record a telephone number if you have problems.

Reviews.Title: “COMFORTABLE STAY”
Reviews.Author: pearlj327
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Doubletree Club LV was very comfortable and relaxing. The front desk was helpfull, professional and very friendly. They give you a welcome cookie that is so good. They have happy hour specials at the bar for beer and well drinks. The room I stayed in was very clean and comfortable. The bed is comfy and the sheets were clean and fresh. I would definetely stay at the Doubletree Club Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean enough, but that's about it.”
Reviews.Author: htnyc
Reviews.Content: The rooms were clean enough but there were stains on pretty much everything. The breakfast was just under $12 and not comped for HHonors Gold. It was a standard cheap continental breakfast that was being sold at a ridiculous rate. The business center was useless. They have a couple of old PCs with some program that blocks you from doing much of anything, three laser printers all hooked up with parallel cables that were unable to print out semi-basic PDFs (like show tickets or google maps) properly because they couldn't handle the fonts. The business center does not have "laptop hookups" as advertised, and the wifi does not really work in the lobby where it is located. Any concern beyond how do I get to the hotel from the airport and the staff acted confused. The shuttle stops at midnight but if you call they will tell you to pay for a cab and they will reimburse (which they did). Also this hotel is kind of in the middle of nowhere. On the plus side it was cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Non-gaming, quiet, convenient, easy”
Reviews.Author: TravelDrone
Reviews.Content: There's nothing fancy about this hotel. It's located off the beaten path, but the location is convenient to the airport and rental car center. I think they have a shuttle to the strip, but most guests have a car and use it. It's a quick 5-minute drive to the south Strip (Mandalay Bay) and even closer to the outlet shopping center and collection of chain restaurants (Outback, etc.) The hotel itself is business oriented, quiet, clean, and sort of plain. The rooms are of decent size, and recent upgrades provide a flat screen TV and better bedding. Still, this is Las Vegas and in relative terms the rooms are plain. Parking is free, and conveniently located all around the hotel. Breakfast options aren't great, but are acceptable for this class of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: bowlingdad
Reviews.Content: Central to everywhere in Las Vegas; less than 20 minutes to anywhere; easily avoid Strip traffic. Clean, sizable room and bath with ample water pressure and temp. No resort fees here... save your money so you can enjoy Fremont Street: the real down-home Vegas. Friendly, courteous staff and a 24 hour pool.

Reviews.Title: “Not Doubletree Quality at all”
Reviews.Author: Nmbhscoach
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in several Doubletree's around the US and this had the worst facilities by far! The towel bar was loose in the bathroom, there were plumbing issues, the entire place including our guest room needed a good rug cleaning, the cafe set up for guests was much below the usual Doubletree standards I've experienced. The carpeting was old and the place needs updating. We went off site to eat breakfast. The adjacent Applebee's was excellent, with great friendly service. Don't forget to ASK for your cookie-it won't be delivered unless you ask. If you have another choice-try that instead!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Room, Bad Service”
Reviews.Author: TravelGuy72
Reviews.Content: I had a one-night layover in LV so booked this based upon its proximity to the airport, the good price, and the fact that it was a Doubletree. The room was fantastic-large, clean, modern, etc. Very comfortable bed. Pool area was adequate but nothing spectacular. Lobby and cafe were nice. Free shuttle goes to airport and MGM Grand and was very convenient. Everything about this room/hotel is great and definitely a good place to stay, but the service was not good for any hotel, much less a Doubletree. Everyone I encountered looked like they hated their job and the guests (except for Frank in the cafe-friendly, nice, great service!). The shuttle drivers were sour and inhospitable. My biggest gripe was the front-desk staff, who were completely sullen and unfriendly. I'm usually not one to complain about this, because who cares, I don't need VIP treatment, but this was to the point that I almost asked them if I was bothering them. And NO COOKIE! I have never been to a Doubletree that wasn't offering me a cookie everytime I walked by the desk. When I checked in they didn't offer me one and I asked if they still did cookies with check-in and the young woman just said "we're out." Bottom line: fine hotel, but don't expect good service.

Reviews.Title: “Great off-the-strip hotel”
Reviews.Author: WorldWalkers1987
Reviews.Content: The price is right for this non-gaming, airport-adjacent hotel. We were there to pick up family from the airport, and the location was ideal. Positives: The hotel was clean and quiet (although we were told that the hotel often hosts youth sports teams, which when there may possibly detract from the quiet atmosphere that we enjoyed). The bed was comfortable, and the room air conditioner was relatively quiet (white noise in the background rather than the loud grinding that many room air conditioners make). The price was excellent and included free parking and NO resort fee. Our room was super spacious, which we needed because we were hauling camping gear for six people. The front desk staff was friendly, competent, and very helpful. Negatives: The hotel restaurant leaves much to be desired, we ended up going to a nearby Applebee's for dinner. Also, continental breakfast is not included with the room price, even though other comparably-priced nearby hotels do include breakfast. Overall, a great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, comfortable, friendly, relaxing off-strip Las Vegas hotel”
Reviews.Author: 747alika
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight the first night of our stay in Las Vegas at the Doubletree Club, before switching to the Holiday Inn where our original reservations were made for the remainder of our visit. We wished we had booked our entire stay here at the Doubletree Club because we really enjoyed our one night stay. Hotel, lobby and rooms are clean, well appointed, quiet. Nice workout gym, full breakfast buffet for $10.95+tax, comped if you are a Hilton HHonors Gold member or higher. Excellent bar with "Happy Hour" pricing after 530pm M-TH, $2 house wines & beers, 2-4-1 well drinks, free finger foods. Free parking, free internet, free business center (computers & meeting room). Free shuttle to nearby Outlet Mall. Our only disappointment was the unheated pool and NO hot tub. Why?

Reviews.Title: “A Hotel that cares about your comfort”
Reviews.Author: CaliGambler
Reviews.Content: I am not one to complete these website reviews, but after my stay last weekend, I feel compelled. I stay in Las Vegas regularly (6-8 times a year), almost always on the Strip. There's a lot to like about the hotels on the Strip, especially the upper end properties and their rooms. Those hotels usually do lack any touch of personality or service, unless you count the valet, bellman, etc, with a hand out for a tip at every turn. This hotel doesn't take a backseat to any of those hotels in quality or service. I can't recall the last time I stayed in a hotel and was asked so many times "is everything okay", "do you need anything", "everything good with your room", etc., etc. And none of these questions seemed to be because they wanted a tip or were working an angle, they seemed to genuinely care and wanted to make sure I was comfortable and enjoying my stay, which I was and very much did. And now the two best parts, free warm chocolate chip cookies every night on my way to bed and my car was never more than two minutes away! Try getting either of those on the Strip! And one last thing, the nights I stayed, the hotel was sold out, as was most of town, and yet the rate was half what it was at much lesser properties on the Strip. I can't say that I will stay there every time in the future, the Strip has its benefits, but it will certainly get my consideration on every future trip.

Reviews.Title: “Thank You Very Much!”
Reviews.Author: buffalobreeze
Reviews.Content: Decided to "volunteer" to miss my flight for a nice travel voucher from Southwest and was stuck in Vegas for a night with no luggage whatsoever, hotel or transportation. Found a good deal at the Doubletree on my phone. Complimentary shuttle was there in 10 minutes to take me to/from the AP. The driver was so very accommodating; offered to take me to a mall since I had nothing with me; was very friendly and outgoing. Their shuttle even goes to and from the strip. The Front Desk and bartender (who I feel bad that I forgot their names) but they went above and beyond finding me a cell phone charger since my phone died. So if you are reading this, the "cell phone guy" says thanks! The rooms were clean, had a nice selection of TV channels; had an Applebee's in front of the hotel which was convenient and was able to walk to a nearby convenient store to grab items I needed. I usually stay on the strip when going to Vegas, but if you are sick of all the hustle and want a quiet night in a good off strip location, I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: EdUrias
Reviews.Content: Stayed four days at this DoubleTree over the Memorial Day weekend and found it a gem! Rooms were clean and the breakfast buffet had something for everyone! I've gained some weight for eating their "infamous" cookies which are a delight! Enjoyed it so much that we booked several rooms for family and friends for the upcoming Fourth of July holiday and obtained a $47.20 room rate. My last experience at a DT in San Diego was not so well, but this stay had changed my opinion about DoubleTree.

Reviews.Title: “It's close to the airport...”
Reviews.Author: jinphil_cho
Reviews.Content: The only reason I even stayed at this hotel was because it was close to the airport and it was the middle of the night and the airport lounges were closed so I just needed somewhere to rest for about 4 hours. Everything about the hotel was just OK. I've been in a lot worse, and I've been in a lot better, too. I know that it's a cheap airport Doubletree and it was the middle of the night, but I really didn't feel that it was quite up to full-service hotel standards. The wireless Internet was terrible, I had better luck connectng to a nearby free network. I'd be willing to give this place another try (and actually stay a whole day) if the price is right, but I'll likely be staying at another hotel next time I'm in town.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but not that clean...and they don't even care”
Reviews.Author: Carolyn_in_Edmonds
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 5-night stay. I checked in on Sunday, and noticed walking to my room on the 4th floor how stained and dirty the hallway carpets were. I also made notice on the way to my room of a pen that had fallen and lay on the floor, and then a plastic strip on the floor next to my door. I kept seeing these literally each day as I came and went. Finally, on Thursday I mentioned it to the front desk manager. I asked whether he read Trip Advisor reviews, as someone also had mentioned the stained carpets. He attributed it to the once-pretty new carpeting that he knew would show stains. I retorted that if you take care of stains promptly, and also vacuum every day, the dirt wouldn't get ground in and look crappy. He then told me that although he was writing down what I told him I saw on the floor (pen and plastic), he didn't want to report it to the Housekeeping Manager, as he kind of wanted to see how long it would take before she would notice and correct it on her own! What sense does that make? I will also state that their Eco policy says that they will only change your linens every 3 days unless you request it sooner. I checked in on a Sunday, and they didn't change my sheets until Thursday, after I had slept on them for 4 nights. I spoke with the Front Desk manager again before I checked out on Friday. I told him specifically where on the 4th floor hallway the pen had been lying since Sunday. He jotted it down, and did say he was embarrassed, but did he do anything about it? I'll probably never know, as I doubt I would stay there again. My other colleagues stayed at other hotels nearby that were cheaper and also included breakfast, unlike the Doubletree.

Reviews.Title: “A good business hotel in las vegas”
Reviews.Author: suman_sasmal
Reviews.Content: while very few go to las vegas on business, but those who do - i am sure will find this hotel very useful. The shuttle to the hotel doesn't go to the international terminal. i had to walk all the way to the domestic terminal. That was the only difficult part. But once u reach. u get what u would expect out of a double tree property. Rooms were good and everything functional. It provides good amenities in the toilets if u have missed to bring something. The location is far from the strip - so if u r the gambling type, this hotel is not for u. This hotel provides a shuttle to the strip though, i would go to this hotel again if i am going on business.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to escape the strip”
Reviews.Author: pjfletcherf1968
Reviews.Content: Upon check-in, was promptly greeted by a clerk who just came back on duty and immediately came over to help while the other girl was with another guest. Room was very nice and quiet even though I was facing the interstate, I had a great sleep. The pool area was clean and towels were readily available. The towels/washrags were extremely soft and the toiletries provided were excellent products.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing - even for a Doubletree”
Reviews.Author: ronr818
Reviews.Content: I don't what it is about Doubletree locations - it's really hit and miss with them. I don't expect luxury from this chain - that's not why they exist. But given that it's a full service hotel I do expect a minimum level of professionalism that was missing on this stay (I've been here before and was treated better). The room itself was clean but the carpeting on the 4th floor has unsightly stains in several places on my way to my room. Does this place want to borrow my carpet cleaner? Room service was the worst. It started with an insolent room service order taker who used as few words as possible. I think the same guy delivered my meal - a chicken caesar salad. The chicken "breast" was made of that spongy, rolled and pressed material that you were served in Jr. High. Really Doubletree? To be fair, the front desk clerk quickly removed the charge when I complained. Positives: cheap rate, free parking, free Internet and that cookie.

Reviews.Title: “clean, friendly staff, convenient to airport.”
Reviews.Author: KAS09
Reviews.Content: pros- friendly staff, convenient to airport, hot cookies on check-in, clean room, comfortable beds. reasonably priced in room dining. cons- the walls are thin! Could here the person in the next room showering at 4am!. Sounded like they were in my room!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay over the Valentines Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Morvin147
Reviews.Content: I hope this review helps the travelers as i currently work in hotel industry. I found a deal on priceline.com that included airfare and hotel. before booking the deal, i researched some comments about Doulbetree hotel and found them all to be great. Doulbetree Club is basically an upgraded Doubletre I arrived at the airport around 10pm, after getting my luggage i approached the shuttle pick up area, in 15 mins the shuttle arrived, the young shuttle driver lady was very sweet and professional and made sure that she has helped me enough to make me feel at home, upon arrival we were assigned a king size smoking room, the staff was very professional and was very engaging, offered us warm cookies, the guy at the bar was very helpful in telling us different clubs and casinos to go to on the strip, we went to our rooms, changed clothes and took a cab to the strip which is not that far (hotel shuttle stops running around 10:30 to the strip and to the airport), first night i went to Newyork Newyork, casino has very high limits on the weekends when its crowded and on the nights, lost alot of money in few hours but made a comeback early in the morning and walked out of the casino with some money. Next morning i visited so many other casinos on the strip as the strip is very flashy and upscale, the service was terrible and people dont treat you or appreciate your business, you are made to feel like " you should be appreciative to be in their presence" . We watched a show on the strip, at night i went to Old Downtown Vegas, saw the light show on freemont street, casinos had a very low limit, from 1 dollar - 5 thousand dollars, now this is what i call gambling when you can gamble as much as you want and as low as you want, really gives you an advantage when to bet more on one hand and lower when you are losing, waitresses were super nice, if you tip them good, they will bring you drinks and keep on checking on you every 5 minutes. They are not as lavish and fancy as the strip but service is impeccable and slot especially are loosest that you can find in Las Vegas. I ended up winning really good money and recieved really good service. Next morning, we were dropped by the hotel shuttle service to MGM Grand at 10am in the morning, our return flight to Dallas was at 6pm so we had plenty of time to roam around and see more of Vegas, The shuttle driver held our bags at the back of the front desk, dropped us on the stripped and picked us back again around 5pm infront of MGM with our bags and dropped us off at the airport - THAT WAS IMPRESSIVE!!! PERSONALIZED SERVICE. Hotel rooms are hotel rooms... its the people who make the real difference, Doubletree staff is exceptional, next time even if i couldnt find a deal on priceline, i would rather book this hotel on a regular price, they truly work hard and make you feel special. I highly recommend this hotel for these reasons. Nice clean rooms, free wifi in the rooms, nice location located right next to the airport, friendly staff, bar , restaurant and coffee shop, pool, shuttle service every hour to the airport and to the vegas strip (pick up and drop service), friendly and down to earth staff who would go beyond their means to make your stay a special one.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel, great sleep”
Reviews.Author: efitravelor
Reviews.Content: I got in very late, checked into a very nice, clean room and had a great night sleep. No complaints, other than the unusual location and had to wait 45 minutes for the shuttle from the airport

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for an early morning flight”
Reviews.Author: scollinson79
Reviews.Content: I stayed here after a stay at the Aria and a subsequent road trip to Flagstaff. Though not as up-scale or as elegant at the Aria it was ten times better than the Hilton product that i stayed at in Flagstaff. The staff was acommadating. They had a shuttle service to the strip as well as to the Airport. It even picked me up from the car rental place. Clean and quite room. The only downsides were minor: a sink that was a little clogged and over-charged for a bottle of water at the bar. Other than that highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay near the airport.”
Reviews.Author: 4cats1house
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel at the beginning and end of our trip. Near the airport & car rental. Quiet comfortable room. Would stay here again when in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay at this site”
Reviews.Author: luvthecookies
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this Doubletree a number of times and will continue to stay when in Vegas. All frontdesk people are pleasant and professional. Loved our room everytime.

Reviews.Title: “Great Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: madwisctraveler
Reviews.Content: An easy 5 minutes from the McCarran Airport car rentals. It was surprisingly quiet for being close to the airport and a good deal. We had an advance purchase, king room. It was very spacious and comfortable. Our room was ready when we checked in at 4:30 (and so was our hot cookie!). We relaxed and had dinner at the bar. Afterward we took a walk and felt very safe. We were looking for quiet and relaxation and we got it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Off the Strip Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dougatdeg
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel if you want to say off the strip, and if you have a car. I think this place is especially good for business travelers like myself who come to Las Vegas to work and not play. The rooms were quiet, beds great, and the flat screen television had a good picture. (One of my requirements.) There is a Starbucks down the street that opens at 4:30, a Chili's next door, and the airport rental car not too far away either. I also found the staff quite nice.

Reviews.Title: “An acceptable option for stay in las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: rollingstoneDubai
Reviews.Content: We booked into this hotel based on location and proximity to the airport ,plus the fact that for this holiday we had booked into quite a few other Double tree properties in the USA . We were satisfied with the hotel , the staff and the service levels .. What really stumped us was the unwillingness of the tour Companies to pick up Guests form this property .I had in fact cancelled my Night tour of Las Vegas , because none of the tour Companies who offered this package were willing to pick up or drop us off at the Double tree property . They instead suggested alternate hotels for pick up and drop off. i even had a problem initially with the tour Co with whom i had booked the Grand canyon day trip (booked thru Viator)..I had to point out that that the tour was sold basis a o pick and drop of at the hotel; i was staying ... I was seriously thinking of cancelling the booking , when the tour Company staff agreed to pick us up from our hotel ..Ironically ,I found after we were picked up from the Double Tree , that our hotel was on the route to the airport where we boarded the flight o Grand canyon .. I highlighted this point to the Manager of Double Tree leaving him a copy of the refusal by one of the night tour operators to pick us up at the Double tree..I guess its up to the Hotel to have this issue resolved with the tour Companies .. Regards

Reviews.Title: “this place is literally a DUMP”
Reviews.Author: jammanxc
Reviews.Content: Rude check in lady , Allison did not want to upgrade me to the Larger non-smoking room with the upgraded amenities. It was not sold out and I even checked doubletree.com on my iphone to see if the room type I wanted was sold out. Clearly, it was available, but as a GOLD VIP member, I was refused an upgrade. I did not get a cookie, ONLY when I requested one at check in. Obviously, she didn't like the way I was dressed or maybe it was a late shift (got up on the wrong side of the bed), but she put me in a room where the view was a parking lot and a dumpster. When I woke up in the morning, the dumpster truck became my wake up call at 6 in the morning. The breakfast was less than stellar. The breakfast buffet was terrible.. the food was cold and not nourishing. The waiter (who was behind the counter at all times), wanted to charge me for a fountain soda and told me that it was not included in the breakfast buffet. He said only orange and cranberry juice was available. I proceeded to pay the man because I was in the mood for a Coke. I've stayed here a few years ago and didn't remember it become a dump. I chose this location because it was convenient to the airport, but I must rethink my hotel choice next time I come to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel near airport.”
Reviews.Author: Smaaaarty
Reviews.Content: Our flight was delayed till next day so the airline booked us here,free transport to hotel from airport was good ,check in was good and was offered toilet products such as razor and deo stick and toothpaste.The room was ok for the night but dont think i would stay longer its location is not so good but the free shuttle bus to the MGM was helpful .A bar and fast food is available we had 2 drinks at the bar a beer and diet coke costing $7 gave the barman$10 im still waiting on $3 change i dont mind giving tips but dont like the change to go automaticaly into his tip box .In all its ok to stay here but its not my style.

Reviews.Title: “Off the Strip. That's About All It Has Going for It. Oh, and NO Hot Water, Too.”
Reviews.Author: Genghisdon
Reviews.Content: As a frequent traveler for business, I am rapidly discovering that many hotels in the Hilton brand are a crapshoot, and my recent stay at the Doubletree Club in Vegas certainly played into that gambling idea. I booked this hotel to get away from the noise and commotion of the Hilton Grand Vacations property on the Strip, but was given a room that faced an road intersection that howled and rumbled all night with Harleys, noisy rice burner cars, and trucks doing a variety of gear shifting. When I asked the front desk staff to change rooms - they were very nice and accommodating, but put me in a room TWO DOORS DOWN AND ON THE SAME SIDE OF THE HOTEL. Since I really didn't feel like moving my stuff after the first move, I toughed it out and cranked up the fan on the A/C unit. The rooms also had a funny, sulfur gassy smell you often find in different parts of Vegas...not sure where it comes from, but it was definitely prevalent on the sixth floor. The big surprise of the stay was to wake up in the morning and have ZERO hot water for the shower. I ran my head under the tub's faucet as an alternative, checked out, and never looked back. I am going to guess the people who post positive reviews about this place are either non-frequent travelers who don't look at the finer details, or are getting WICKED cheap rates through Hotwire or Priceline and are just happy to be not paying the rate I paid. Best adivice - if you're a Hilton person, stay at the Hilton Garden Inn right around the corner on S. Las Vegas Blvd...I regretted not doing the same.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis of Normality in the Middle of Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: ZBTUsa
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel and it was made even better as we booked our rooms for a great price on Hotwire. We would definitely stay here again though for the normal price. The rooms were beautiful, the lobby was nice and the pool area was very good too.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff. I can't wait to come back!”
Reviews.Author: weary_traveller25
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Doubletree Club Hotel on a business trip and I was really impressed. The staff were incredibly friendly and extremely helpful. Every single person went the extra mile to make sure that every thing was perfect. They all addressed me by my first name, which was a very nice touch. They also greeted each guest with a fresh cookie. The hotel was fairly new and had some wonderful amenities. There was a nice hotel restaurant and a hotel bar just off the lobby, which made it easy to work in the hotel. The hotel had a web based printing service so that you could print directly from your laptop anywhere in the hotel using their wireless network. There was a pool and a very good fitness center. The room was great too. It was very clean and had all the creature comforts. It had a refrigerator and microwave and a large screen television. The bed was extremely comfortable. The shuttle ran to and from the airport at the top of the hour, and also ran to the MGM Grand in the middle of the Las Vegas strip. If you want to step out for a bite, there is an Applebee's right next door. I've been to Las Vegas twice this year and I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A nice suprise”
Reviews.Author: AussieMillers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Double Tree for one night before driving to the Grand Canyon. After travelling around the US on honeymoon and finding most hotel staff and services quite rude we were so pleasantly suprised that the Double Tree airport hotel of all places had the best service! After hearing we were on honeymoon they upgraded our room (most other hotels we stayed at merely grunted at us when we said we were on honeymoon). The cookie upon arriving was delicious and such a nice touch. The rooms were great and the location perfect for a quick stopover.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT USE HILTON.COM PREPAY FEATURE...TAKES YOUR MONEYAND NEVER RETURNS IT!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: DeeWestChester_OH
Reviews.Content: We traveled in and out of Las Vegas on a tour of Southern Utah in May, 2010. The hotel itself was actually quite nice. However booking the property was and continues to be an absolute NIGHTMARE! On Mar 5, 2010 I attempted twice to book our rooms on prepay option on Hilton.com. I did not get a confirmation of either reservation so I called Hilton's 800 number and made the reservations. Two days later prepayments for the two reservations I attempted to make on Hilton.com appeared on our credit card. I called Hilton and was told that both reservations made on-line would be credited to my credit card within 2-3 weeks. The first reservation was credited to our card within days. HOWEVER, after numerous phone calls to Hilton Customer Service, I continue to be promised my money back (approx $130) but I have never received it!!! It has been 4 MONTHS NOW!!! I have spent hours on this as it takes a LONG time to reach a person to talk with on Hilton Customer Service. Several times I've just hung up after 20 minutes on hold! The last conversation I had with them 2 weeks ago, I was on hold for 54 MINUTES before I reached anyone about my problem. SO, NEVER USE PREPAY OPTION ON HILTON.COM!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! I will never use Hilton Hotels again and I'm an Honors Member! Deb Buden West Chester, Ohio

Reviews.Title: “Cheaper but not Better”
Reviews.Author: Globebugs
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights each on consecutive weekends as the Strip hotels were so much more expensive. Cheaper is not necessarily better though as as was the case in staying here. The rooms are showing some wear and tear but the beds were comfortable. The Neutrogena amenities in the bathroom were nice but found that not everything was provided in the different rooms we had over the two stays. We guess this comes down to housekeeping. The weather was cooler than normal which was good as the old style, window air con was very noisy and a good sleep would have been impossible if on constantly. Being an airport hotel you run the risk of having noisy neighbours or or what sounded like people moving house overhead in the middle of the night. Our sleep quality really suffered both stays. Our summer rate included a buffet breakfast at the concession near the lobby.The usual price if we had paid magically increased on one of the weekend stays.For us it seemed the price wasn't worth the quality provided.The hot selection was cold so you would be better having the continental side of it.Definitely not worth the money compared to Vegas prices elsewhere.You could order individual items in lieu of the buffet at various prices. Go to Applebees next door for better quality for the money. We found the reception staff indifferent but enjoyed the traditional warm cookies on arrivals.Tried the gym and it was very good but too cold to use the outside pool for this time of year. The free shuttle to the airport came in handy but finding the shuttle stop at the airport was difficult especially with a heavy luggage. Turn right after baggage reclaim, walk towards the car park.There are no hotel shuttle signs or phone connection to the hotel. Hail it down when you see it. Would we stay again? Probably not. This hotel serves a purpose for Airport reasons but there are much quieter hotels off the strip if your trip is more than just a transit.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for business travelers”
Reviews.Author: WisconsinHappyfeet
Reviews.Content: If looking to be in the middle of it all in Vegas this is not the hotel for you. But the hotel does offer a quick complimentary shuttle to MGM that can get you there quickly. They also offer shuttles to the airport which is nice if you aren't renting a car. Have stayed here several times and have never had any issues. During last stay the staff recommended a resturant close by that turned out to be amazing (Table 34)

Reviews.Title: “Good for an overnight at the Airport”
Reviews.Author: dcl80
Reviews.Content: A good hotel. Location is good for the airport the shuttle service was also just fine. Room was good, staff was good. It is not like other DoubleTree hotels I have been to.. reminded me more like an Hilton Garden Inn, no suites or upgraded rooms. Breakfast was made to order from a bar line set up. I would stay here again.. but really nothing to look forward too. Clean, good price and good staff. This would not be a good place if you want to be around the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Place was fine, but does not always answer phone”
Reviews.Author: Southside
Reviews.Content: Nice, basic place with a free shuttle to the airport and a decent breakfast. Walls seemed a bit thin in terms of noise from next door, but after I put in ear plugs to sleep that was no problem. Friendly staff, though a had to call a couple of times before someone picked up the phone.

Reviews.Title: “Doubletree- good hotel with nice perks. Good for staying near the airport”
Reviews.Author: datdan
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night at doubletree Las Vegas airport. I picked this hotel because our flight would be arriving late and wanted a close place to spend 1 night. Checked in near 1 AM. Staff was pleasant and it was a quick trip to our room. Room was decent size, comfortable bed, had a mini-fridge, flat screen tv and over-looked the pool. Bathroom included great products including neutrogena face wash. The room was fairly quite couldn't really hear the hallway noise. My wife thought the room felt a bit dark (not necessarily dingy) but mostly because of decorative touches. I thought it was fine and one could tell room was recently re-done. The free internet worked well. I am Hilton Gold member so received free breakfast coupons. The restaurant gave quite a number of options for breakfast (buffet $10 without coupon, or choice of breakfast sandwiches, fruit etc). Overall good hotel with lots of amenities useful for traveler who wants to stay near the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Add me to the list: great choice; free (slow) shuttle to airport”
Reviews.Author: 2Midwest
Reviews.Content: I have a Hhonors reward night stay at this property. As other reviewers noted, it is a great property: clean, handy to airport, fairly quiet, nice amenities, friendly staff. Bed sheets could have been crisper. Free shuttle to airport apparently a rarity in Las Vegas: this is one of the few properties that has one. However, "he will be there is 5 minutes" turned into a 40 minuted (annoying) wait. Tell the front desk to have the shuttle wait for you. All in all, a great stay if you are not looking to stay in a casino hotel on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly serviceable and especially convenient to the airport”
Reviews.Author: nancyesca
Reviews.Content: I got stuck in Las Vegas an extra night and wanted something close to the airport. Not only is this close, but they offer a shuttle - one of the few to offer that. The hallway could have used a vacuuming, but overall the place was fine for a night or two. I ate at some chain restaurant nearby - just a walk across the parking lot. The shuttles were prompt and takes less than 10 minutes to get to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location but a few operational glitches”
Reviews.Author: HiIslandsGuy
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because it was close to the airport, they had an airport shuttle, and I didn't want to get caught up in all of the activity of the Strip. But when I arrived at the airport at 9pm, I tried to call the hotel to find out when I could expect the shuttle--- and no one would answer the phone! I tried again and again and even called Hilton reservations to make sure I had the right number. (They couldn't get anyone to answer either!) In the meantime the shuttle bus showed. But if you're expecting some important calls, this may not be the place for you; try calling the hotel in the evening yourself and then decide. The front desk is also a little mixed up. They made several mistakes, that although not serious, caused me inconvenience. To the hotel's credit, they worked hard to make these mistakes "right" and apologized profusely. The rooms are spacious and well equipped. The bathroom has extra amenities. The housekeeping was excellent. The beds are comfortable. There was a slight amount of crossover noise from the next room. The airconditioning unit (in both rooms I stayed in on two different stays) was quite noisey. I also tried to turn down the controls to a lower fan speed without success. The shuttle bus IS a great convenience. And the hotel IS close to the airport. If it could just work these bugs out of their system I would consider going back.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, peaceful, close to airport & no gambling”
Reviews.Author: vineyardchick
Reviews.Content: Spouse & I sought a quiet restful hotel for the end of our CA-NV vacation that didn't include noise & raucousness of slot machines & gambling. Reviewed AAA info & found this hotel where no gambling or slot machines exist. Our reservations were honored even though we arrived early, were able to check in & offered freshly baked cookies. Our room was beautifully appointed, clean. The hotel's location to the airport was a huge plus for us as we were departing early the next day. We couldn't figure out if the hotel was open for cocktails, appetizers or whatever.We went down to the lounge area after check in & found the lounge area dark. So we went to Applebee's across the parking lot from the hotel & had a good dinner & drinks. This is a great place to stay but you have to know what you are getting for your $$$.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Pre-Flight Hotel - Near McCarren Rental Car Return”
Reviews.Author: rwethereyet850
Reviews.Content: I always stay at this hotel the night before an early flight. It's about a straight-shot, no traffic mile away from the rental car return which makes it a TON easier to get to the airport without event. The staff can be a bit sketchy and the breakfast (if you stay for it) is pretty meager, but the rooms are really nice and it's one of the fewer places in Vegas that actually have decent channel selection on the television! There's also an Applebee's right behind the hotel, and the outlet mall with nearby restaurants are just down the road.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, clean, reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: TravelATreat
Reviews.Content: This 6-story hotel is located in a business park south of the airport. It caters to the business traveller. My room was on the 5th floor and faced the freeway, which is just across the parking lot. The freeway noise was quite muffled and didn't bother me. I did hear a helicopter at one point in the morning; I believe a helicopter tour company is close by. I did not consider it a problem. I heard absolutely NO showering noise. A couple of times, I heard voices in the hallway, but during waking hours. This is not a place that attracts partiers. I didn't use the AC, so can't comment on that. To catch the shuttle from the airport, walk across the baggage claim area, go down to Zero Level, and go out to the parking lot. The hotel shuttles pick people up in the middle of this lot. Call the hotel from there, and they'll tell you when the shuttle is coming. It stopped at the MGM Grand after the airport; a jerk who also got on the shuttle at the airport complained about this, swore at the driver, and was told to get off at the MGM Grand. Be nice to people and they will be nice to you! You will be given a cookie on check-in. Breakfast is not included, but a simple hot breakfast buffet can be purchased for $7.95. It includes coffee, canned juice, scrambled eggs, potatoes, sausage or bacon, waffles (previously frozen), toast, fruit or fruit cup, and cereal.
